com.samysadi.acs.service.checkpointing

Interface CheckpointingHandler<E extends RunnableEntity,C extends Checkpoint<E,?>>

  • Type Parameters:
    E - the type of the RunnableEntity for which the checkpoints are created
    C - the type of the Checkpoint which is created
    All Superinterfaces:
    Cloneable, Entity, Notifier, Probed
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    VmCheckpointingHandler
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CheckpointingHandlerAbstract, VmCheckpointingHandlerAbstract, VmCheckpointingHandlerDefault

    public interface CheckpointingHandler<E extends RunnableEntity,C extends Checkpoint<E,?>>
extends Entity
    This interface defines methods to register a RunnableEntity for automatic checkpointing and recovery.

    Once an entity is registered, common implementations will regularly create a checkpoint for the entity. Then once the entity fails, the entity is automatically recovered.

    It is left to implementations to define how many checkpoints are created for each registered entity, and at which frequency they are created.
    They should also define their own policies to select the right checkpoint to use during the recovery process.

    Finally, the creation (or the selection) of the MemoryZone to use to save a checkpoint is also left to implementations.
    In a like manner, during recovery, and after that a new RunnableEntity is created, it is left to implementations to define its parent.

    Since:
    1.2

    • Method Detail

      • clone

        CheckpointingHandler<E,C> clone()
        Description copied from interface: Entity
        Creates a clone of this entity and sets its parent to null.

        This is a deep clone method which also clones almost all children entities and sets their parents to the newly created clone. The only children which are not cloned are those implementing the UncloneableEntity interface.

        Implementations must ensure that the new clone will be independent from the current entity.

        Specified by:
        clone in interface Entity
        Specified by:
        clone in interface Notifier

      • register

        void register(E entity,
            Config checkpointConfig)
        Registers the given entity, and enables automatic checkpointing and recovery for it.

        The frequency of the checkpointing is defined by the implementation. In a like manner, the choice of the backup MemoryZone to use for saving the created checkpoints is implementation-specific. It is also left to implementations to the chose where a recovered entity is to be placed.

        A NotificationCodes.CHECKPOINTINGHANDLER_REGISTERED notification is thrown after that the given entity is registered.
        Additionally, each time a checkpoint is created for a registered entity, then a NotificationCodes.CHECKPOINTINGHANDLER_CHECKPOINT_CREATION_SUCCESS notification is thrown. And if an error happens, then a NotificationCodes.CHECKPOINTINGHANDLER_CHECKPOINT_CREATION_ERROR notification is thrown.

        Each time a checkpoint is automatically updated, a NotificationCodes.CHECKPOINTINGHANDLER_AUTOUPDATE_SUCCESS or a NotificationCodes.CHECKPOINTINGHANDLER_AUTOUPDATE_ERROR notification is thrown.

        Each time a checkpoint is used for recovery, a NotificationCodes.CHECKPOINTINGHANDLER_AUTORECOVER_SUCCESS or a NotificationCodes.CHECKPOINTINGHANDLER_AUTORECOVER_ERROR notification is thrown.

        If after a given set of tries, this handler fails to update (or to recover) a given entity, then the automatic update process and recovery process are aborted for that entity. Additionally, the entity is automatically unregistered (see unregister(RunnableEntity)).

        After that a checkpoint is successfully used for recovery, the entity that has failed is unregistered (see unregister(RunnableEntity)) and the newly recovered entity is registered using this same method.

        Parameters:
        entity - the entity to register for automatic checkpointing/recovery
        checkpointConfig - the configuration which is assigned to checkpoints when creating them (can be null, in which case the CheckpointingHandler's config is used)
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given entity is already registered

      • unregister

        void unregister(E entity)
        Unregisters the given entity.
        No further automatic checkpointing or automatic recovery is performed.

        All previously automatically created checkpoints by current CheckpointingHandler are deleted using the deleteCheckpoint(Checkpoint) method.
        Checkpoints created using takeCheckpoint(RunnableEntity, Config) are not deleted.

        A NotificationCodes.CHECKPOINTINGHANDLER_UNREGISTERED notification is thrown after that the given entity is unregistered.

        Parameters:
        entity -
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given entity is not registered

      • isRegistered

        boolean isRegistered(E entity)
        Returns true if the given entity has been registered using this CheckpointingHandler.
        Parameters:
        entity -
        Returns:
        true if the given entity has been registered

      • takeCheckpoint

        void takeCheckpoint(E entity,
                  Config checkpointConfig)
        Creates a checkpoint for the given entity and then updates it.

        After that the checkpoint is created, a NotificationCodes.CHECKPOINTINGHANDLER_CHECKPOINT_CREATION_SUCCESS notification is thrown. And if an error happens, then a NotificationCodes.CHECKPOINTINGHANDLER_CHECKPOINT_CREATION_ERROR notification is thrown.

        The Checkpoint.update() method is called as soon as possible on the created checkpoint. However, you should listen to appropriate notifications on the created checkpoint to know when the checkpoint is updated (and if the update is successful).

        Parameters:
        entity - the entity for which a checkpoint is created
        checkpointConfig - the configuration which is assigned to checkpoints when creating them (can be null, in which case the CheckpointingHandler's config is used)

      • recover

        void recover(E entity)
        Uses the current CheckpointingHandler policies to recover the entity using one of its checkpoints.

        After that a checkpoint is found for recovery, a NotificationCodes.CHECKPOINTINGHANDLER_CHECKPOINT_SELECTION_SUCCESS notification is thrown. And if an error happens, then a NotificationCodes.CHECKPOINTINGHANDLER_CHECKPOINT_SELECTION_ERROR notification is thrown.

        Usually, the checkpoint that is used for recovery is the most recent checkpoint. However, nothing guarantees this behavior and it is left to implementations to chose the right checkpoint.

        The Checkpoint.recover(Entity, RunnableEntity) method is called as soon as possible on the chosen checkpoint. However, you should listen to appropriate notifications on the chosen checkpoint to know when the recovery process is finished (and if the recovery is successful).

        It is left to implementations to chose where the recovered entity is to be placed.

        Parameters:
        entity -

      • recover

        void recover(C checkpoint)
        Uses the current CheckpointingHandler policies to recover an entity using the given checkpoint.

        If the given checkpoint can be used for recovery, then a NotificationCodes.CHECKPOINTINGHANDLER_CHECKPOINT_SELECTION_SUCCESS notification is thrown. And if it cannot be used, then a NotificationCodes.CHECKPOINTINGHANDLER_CHECKPOINT_SELECTION_ERROR notification is thrown.

        The Checkpoint.recover(Entity, RunnableEntity) method is called as soon as possible on the given checkpoint. However, you should listen to appropriate notifications on the given checkpoint to know when the recovery process is finished (and if the recovery is successful).

        It is left to implementations to chose where the recovered entity is to be placed.

        Parameters:
        checkpoint -

      • deleteCheckpoint

        void deleteCheckpoint(C c)
        Schedules a delete event for the given checkpoint.

        This method, on top of calling Checkpoint.delete() on the checkpoint, will free any resources allocated by the current checkpointing handler. Thus, the MemoryZone used by the checkpoint is unplaced if it was placed by the current CheckpointingHandler. Finally, the null parent is also set for the deleted checkpoint.

        If the checkpoint is busy (e.g. updating) then it cannot be deleted immediately, and an event is scheduled to delete the checkpoint as soon as the checkpoint is not busy.

        After that the checkpoint is deleted, a NotificationCodes.CHECKPOINTINGHANDLER_CHECKPOINT_DELETED notification is thrown.

        Parameters:
        c -
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given checkpoint was not created using this CheckpointingHandler
